name: Incarnate: book 1 - Hell is where the heart is

description:
Damien Hellstrom has gone to Hell with Simon Garth a.k.a. the Zombie giving him a grand tour to reveal hell of all its chaos.

An existentialist speech for the ages, Hellstorm reflects how life after death is as much hell as it is in life, and Hellstorm learns that he is far more closer to his infernal father than he realizes.
name: Incarnate: book 2 - Life in Hell

description: Damien Hellstrom is brooding over his past battle against his father Marduk Kurios with equal parts relief and regret. The Gargoyle has gotten vexed with Damien's bad temper which turns around to Hellstorm seeking intermediary to a murdered spiritual adviser. Gabriel Rosetti has a falling out with drugs. A demon suffice on sacrificial murder wanders known as Zahgurim with an avatar Armorer. Damien's sister Satana becomes a soul eating street-walker. And the introduction of author Warren Ellis debuts here.
name: Red Miracles

description: Interventions are met as Hellstorm makes a partnership within San Francisco to ally with the satanic priest Anton Devine and the heretic terrorist Jaine Cutter as the two are pursued by angel assassins- The Asura- for their deflections of faith. Gabriel Rosetti is also falling under divine intervention from renegade angels, but Hellstorm is after the demon murderer of his friend- Armorer- and suspects a connection between Heaven and Hell against humanity.
name: Red Miracles: Sidewalking

description: Repercussions since after their last battle, Hellstorm sets to Florida through effects by Anton Devine with Jaine Cutter to exorcise a Hell-god from slaughtering a friend, occultist author Jack Wintergarden, against the evils of demon goddess Inanna and her torturous servant - the Bailiff - in a condemned haunted house that puts the phrase "housewarming" to diabolical descents.
name: Cigarette Dawn

description:
Of special note: This issue's letter column has a letter by comic writer Garth Ennis

Dr. Stephen Loss makes a house call to the home of Damien Hellstrom to reveal his past against his Devil father, Marduk Kurios, the cultist punishments of his mother and the expected fates of he and his sister Satana. The late voice of Damien's late wife also echoes into Hellstorm's conscience. Anton Devine and Jaine Cutter then question their loyalties as to whether they have been rescued by the enemy.
name: Down Here

description: Hellstorm is set to New Mexico to explore what fate may draw its dark hand on the likeness of a serial killer in a monastary who finds an ancient spell that allows him to murder with a thought. The presence of the exiled demon-lord, Somnambulist, exorcises his efforts in sacrifice and sin to rise a dark tome to gain license of Earth. Hellstorm thinks otherwise to this sacrilege.
name: The Saint of the Pit

description: Gabriel Rosetti is overtaking his own song and dance merrily executing a Satanic cult within a city's confides. A back story on Dr. Stephen Loss's arcane equipment is showcased while Damien Hellstrom and the lovely Jaine Cutter spend time in dark corners reflecting on their next modus operandi.
name: Bad Days Will End

description: Damien Hellstrom sets to Bend Sinister, Utah to confront a dilapidated shack that contains four Satanists, one of which is possessed by a renegade angel set to make an example of one of such heathens in a necromantic circle. Hellstorm is confronted by one Dr. Stephen Loss to intervene in an exorcism, but Hellstorm has something more infernal in mind...
name: Angel in Aspic

description: An issue for the ladies in three parts; Satana Hellstrom gains a personal following within a desecrated church of sinners where she eats at their souls as a succubust. Janie Cutter becomes suspicious in her apartment against potential witch hunters. Finally, La Voison comes to learning she is with child.
name: Femme Fatale

description: Final Issue
name: I'm losing more than i'll ever have

description:
1st story: "Black Magic"

2nd story: "Honey Is Money": Technet's own short story.
name: Black Magic / Honey is Money

description:
1st story: "The Interpretation Of Dreams" Captain Birtain now known in the future as Britanic and his sister Psylocke try to go through their crazy brother's mind, Jamie Braddock, to bring him out of his coma. They are trying to help him but still he rebels agasint them. In the end Nightcrawler has to step in and help.

2nd story: "Black Queen Rising" Nightcrawler's girlfriend Amanda is summoned to help a spooling chamber trapped in it the Black Queen. Amanda lets the witch out and is about to be thrown into the chamber before Nightcrawler blocks Black Queen from pushing her. Amanda has to beat the witch in order to free Nightcrawler and escape the building before it is blown to pieces.

3rd story: "A Change Of Worlds" In the final story Kitty finds out details from her close friend Douglock's sad life. She tries to talk to Douglok trying to resurface his human nature but it doesn't work. Nightcrawler helps her emotionally in the end.
name: The Interpretation Of Dreams /  Black Queen Rising / A Change Of Worlds

description:
Morbius stalks the streets of New York, searching for a deserving victim to satisfy his blood thirst. He comes across a thug shaking down a grocery store owner for protection money, and feeds on his blood. He then retrieves his medical bag and, ducking into an alleyway, injects himself with the serum that alters his appearance to pass for normal.

In his guise as Dr. Morgan Michaels, Michael Morbius goes to work at St. Jude's hospital. He visits his new friend, Lena, who has just gotten a job cleaning the morgue. When she tells him she intends to go the establishment called the Jagged Club to pick up some belongings, he insists it's too dangerous for her, and promises to retrieve her things himself that evening.

Michaels makes his rounds and encounters a group of children mourning the death of their guardian Robin who had just been murdered. He tries to comfort them with little success. Leaving in the company of his friend and confidante, Dr. Jacob Weisenthal, he swears to find Robin's killer and avenge him. He goes to the morgue to get a look at Robin, then recognizes him as the thug he attacked that morning. Michaels goes into a rage, and conflicted by the fact that even some criminals have their good qualities, swears to never again drink anyone's blood.

Meanwhile, Martine Bancroft, Morbius' jilted, and currently undead, former lover, has found a new place to reside: a warehouse loft from which she can observe Morbius' apartment. She later has a drink at the neighborhood pub, where Jack Russell happens by. They talk, and Jack transforms into the Werewolf when he realizes Martine has ill intentions for Morbius. He warns her to watch her step.
name: Jagged Edge III

description:
Morbius forces his way into the Jagged Club and confronts Phelps, the owner who is also involved in kidnapping and prostitution. He fights back his blood thirst, having sworn never again to victimize anyone, and instead demands the belongings of Lena Ivana, his new romantic interest. He then binds Phelps and phones the police. They arrive and Morbius makes his way to his lab at St. Jude's Hospital.

There, his friend and confidante Dr. Jacob Weisenthal visits him and tries to persuade Morbius not to avoid his blood thirst, a decision which could cost him his life. Also, he brings the news that he may have a cure for Martine Bancroft, Morbius' undead former lover. Martine, meanwhile, has begun a sexual affair with Jack Russell (the Werewolf).

At the hospital, Lena looks for Morbius in his human guise of Morgan Michaels. Not finding him, she assumes he was unable to procure her things from the Jagged Club, and heads out to do so herself, leaving him a note saying as much. As Jacob leaves to finish the formula, Morbius finds Lena's note. He rushes to take the serum that makes him appear normal, then runs out after her, catching her as she nearly boards a bus. However, weakened by not feeding, Michaels excuses himself, then fortuitously crosses paths with Russell. Russell provides a ride to Morbius' apartment where the living vampire chains himself to the wall to prevent himself from hunting for victims. Jack becomes the Werewolf and begs him not to risk his life this way.

Eventually, Morbius breaks free of his chains and attacks the Werewolf, knocking him unconscious. He nearly feeds on his friend's blood, but stops himself and goes to the window where he sees the rising sun. His skin blisters and he passes out. Jacob arrives with his serum, and injects Morbius, but it seems the Living Vampire no longer lives.
name: Jagged Edge: Part 4 - The Dawning

description:
Apparently, Morbius is dead, a victim of his self-imposed prohibition against drinking blood. In his apartment, his friends and confidantes, Dr. Jacob Weisenthal and Jack Russell (the Werewolf) determine it would be best to sneak Morbius' body quietly into the morgue at St. Jude's Hospital. As they do so, a nosy tabloid photographer who has been snooping around for dirt, sees Morbius' body and snaps a shot.

Jack goes to Cypress Hills Cemetery to see Caretaker and make arrangements for a quick, quiet funeral. He then goes to the bar where Dan Ketch works, to inform him of Morbius' demise. Later, he finds Martine Bancroft, Morbius' undead former lover, and delivers the news.

The next night, with Jericho Drumm officiating, Morbius is buried. Within the casket, the Darkhold Dwarf materializes and speaks of the deal Morbius made with Chthon to resurrect Martine. Morbius' end of the deal unfulfilled, he revives the Living Vampire, then vanishes. Morbius realizes his situation, and after initially panicking, lies there to hear the eulogies of his friends and allies. When he hears Lena's voice, he gathers every iota of his strength and bursts free from his grave. He tells Jacob he feels different; he feels alive.

The next morning, with the public having learned of the death of the Living Vampire, a crowd has gathered at the cemetery, including allies, foes and citizens there to celebrate his demise. Spider-Man pays his respects and leaves as flowers from Modred and Wildpride materialize by his headstone.
name: Ashes to Ashes

description:
In his guise as Dr. Morgan Michaels, Michael Morbius is in his lab at St. Jude's Hospital pondering the recent physiological changes he's undergone: each midnight, his fingernails, ears and incisors grow to vampiric appearance, but he no longer feels the need to feed on the blood of the living.  As he examines himself, a nurse enters, then screams in shock.  He quickly hypnotizes her to forget seeing him that way.
Later, drinking at a bar, he is joined by his Friend and confidante Dr. Jacob Weisenthal.  They discuss the possibility that the combination of Morbius' near-death and the serum Jacob formulated for Morbius' former undead lover, Martine, may have caused the changes.  Morbius and Jacob leave the bar, and after he scares off some would-be muggers, Morbius flies to his home.
Martine, meanwhile, continues her affair with Jack Russell.  And elsewhere, Morbius' romantic interest, Lena Ivana, witnesses a woman being roughly pushed into a car that drives off, but gets stuck in traffic.  She calls the police, but when they arrive, they tell her they can do nothing, as the alleged kidnapper has diplomatic immunity.
The next day at St. Jude's, Morbius, as Dr. Michaels, meets Lena and asks for a date, which she accepts.  At that moment, Martine makes her way to the Hospital.   Later, Morbius is called to the emergency room to operate on a street corner Santa who has been violently attacked.  He then has a psychotic episode focusing on the blood of his patient.  As Lena and Martine converge, Morbius finds himself sitting and moaning, covered in blood.
name: New Blood

description: For the first time, Keith (Nightmask) Remsen and his sister Teddy cross into a dream on a controlled basis ... and almost cause the death of a patient!
name: Hide And Seek!

description: Adventure in the realm of the mind, as Keith Remsen is seduced by Mistress Twilight - and his sister Teddy is forced to face the unknown without his help!
name: Burnout

description: Can Keith (Nightmask) Remsen possibly survive a duel to the death with Mistress Midnight?
name: Midnight Approaches

description: In the aftermath of his battle with Mistress Midnight and the Gnome, Keith (Nightmask) Remsen tries to bridge the gap between his sister and himself! But first he'll have to take on the bizarre Walker in the dimension of dreams - without Teddy to serve as a psychic anchor!
name: Dream Kill

description: Why would anyone want to kidnap a crippled teen-aged girl? Nightmask wants to know, too - that girl is his sister! His quest to discover the truth leads him to a nightmare which he may never escape!
name: Sender

description: Nightmask must enter a young delinquent's dreams and stop him before he destroys himself.
name: Something More Than Night

description: The nightmare begins for Nightmask when he meets Justice!
name: Transfer Point

description: Nightmask enters his own dreas to discover the identity of the mysterious woman that's been haunting his sleep.
name: (Tell Me)... Who Do You Love?
Drums For Damballah
Nightmare In New Orleans
Voodoo Moon Over Haiti

description: Mento holds Aqualad captive and psychologically tortures him, taking Garth on a nightmarish trip through his life.
name: Scar Tissue

description: During a routine mission, the Brotherhood of Evil is teleported to a strange new land, where they learn that they may be the last hope for the doomed planet.
name: The Brotherhood Is Dead

description: Wonder Girl must save her husband Terry Long from drug runners in El Salvador.
name: Remote Fastness

description:
Two-Face has kidnapped Victor Stone's girlfriend! In order to rescue his love, Cyborg must face a gauntlet of traps and public humiliation--and confront the fact that maybe he and the villain aren't so different after all.

After kidnapping Cyborg's girlfriend, Two-Face puts the Teen Titan through a rigorous gauntlet of clues, traps, and public humiliation in order to prove a point: Harvey and Vic are alike, and only circumstance made one a hero and the other a villain. By the end, both characters are forced to look in their respective mirrors and ask themselves, "What makes a man... and what makes a monster?"
name: The Two Faces of Evil!

description: Starfire receives a message Darkfire.  He has managed to escape from their sister Blackfire.  He has rejoined his friends the Omega Men.  The group is searching for their lost leader Primus and his wife Kalista,
name: Leaving Home

description:
When the Atomic Skull runs amok at S.T.A.R. Labs, it's up to Thunder and Lightning and Frances Kane to contain him.

Thunder and Lightning are called to respond to a disturbance at STAR Labs. They encounter the Atomic Skull and Magenta. However, Both are being seen by a doctor to pacify their evil alter-egos. When the doctor offers to help Lightning with his fear of his own powers, Thunder realizes something is wrong.
name: Second Thoughts

description: Frances Kane has been activated as an assassin called Magenta by S.T.A.R. Lab doctor Alysia Demalis--and she's programmed to kill Thunder & Lightning!
name: Frances Kane Isn't Herself Today

description:
1. Cover by Arthur Thibert.
  2. Written by Dan Mishkin and Gary Cohn, penciled and inked by Arthur Thibert, colored by Adrienne Roy and lettered by John Costanza.

Note: All characters have flashback cameos except Aquaman, Aqualad and the Manhunters.

Aqualad works with Aquaman to try to regain his aquatic telepathy; however, Manhunter agents attack the two heroes.
name: Sea Change

description:
1. Cover by George Perez.
  2. Written by Barbara Randall, penciled by Colleen Doran, inked by Dennis Janke, colored by Adrienne Roy and lettered by Todd Klein.

Manhunter agents ambush Starfire and Harbinger, leading them into a battle that crosses over with the "Millennium" event!
name: Once In A Millennium

description: Cyborg and Changeling get a call for help from Nick, a Jamaican computer hacker with a unique infestation problem in his apartment.
name: Blenders From Hell!

Reprint of Silver Surfer Volume 1 #14: The first confrontation of the Silver Surfer and the original Spiderman.

Reprint from Warlock #11 (1976)

description: In Amsterdam, 2033, life is at a boiling point. The world is being sliced up by the corporations, and the corporations are being sliced up by Thexoll, a megalomaniac with designs on godhood. A backlash movement is forming in the streets. The people are ready to take back what is theirs. Into the middle of the chaos comes Hans. He's already lived through rioting and upheaval, and now he just wants to disappear. Unfortunately, with assassination plots, underground newspapers, and a secret, yet volatile, family history, the anonymous life Hans desires may be more difficult than he thinks.
name: Amsterdam Part 1

description: After a protest ends in violence, Hans flees from his newfound friends. Confused and afraid, he wanders the streets of Amsterdam, where he runs into more trouble! Hans' young friend Marx has lost his dog to the evil Dr. Zemph, creator of a deadly growth drug. Zemph is now collecting human subjects for his nefarious research! Will Hans be next? Meanwhile, Lucien and the others are under surveillance by Securopa and could lose their home. Little do they know, Hans may be the source of Securopa's newfound interest in their group.

Hans fled the political turmoil of America for the calmer streets of Amsterdam; now walking those European streets is like walking a bed of hot coals, and Hans finds himself once again up to his neck in other men's power struggles. A crazy scientist named Zemph, he discovers, is abducting junkies for use in expirements, and there's a dirty trail leading from Zemph's labs back to the offices of big business conglomerate Thexoll. Can greed lead to murder, and capitalism to horror? Hans takes inspiration from Willem's Triple X newspaper, the legendary propaganda machine that sought to bring the Multi-Nationals to their knees. Putting his story to paper, he's going to alert the world to the threat that hides in the quiet of Amsterdam. From a small seed of truth grow the roots of dissension.

Hans has discovered Dr. Zemph's insidious plan for his amazing growth serum, and he wants to warn the world. The only problem is, the world thinks Hans is a terrorist! After narrowly escaping arrest, Hans finds his mission becoming more crucial and his methods more desperate. Dressed as a woman, he sneaks into Thexoll's party to speak with Klaar, the reporter who just might believe him. There, he discovers that he is wanted not just by the law, but he's become a target of the diabolical Rhine Lords, as well. Meanwhile, Thexoll learns that Lucien's temper is much more explosive than anyone accounted for, and the cops zone in on the squatters' home.

There's no time to breathe when you're running for your life. With the Rhine Lords in hot pursuit, Hans boards the train for Rotterdam. Unbeknownst to him, he has a new ally in Klaar, who is heading in the same direction to get to the bottom of what could be the story of the century. Far behind them, the squatters' home is under attack by Securopa. Working under orders from Thexoll, the deadly security team won't stop until the building is destroyed, along with everyone who knows about Thexoll's depraved dealings.

Hans descends deep into the lair of Dr. Zemph and stumbles into the disgusting consequences of the scientist's evil experiments -- literally! Propelled through a river of toxic waste, Hans washes up on Zemph's doorstep, just in time to see the doctor's hideous creation come to life. Injected with the growth serum, one of the kidnapped street urchins has been turned into an inhuman giant, only to become a pawn in a political power struggle. On top of all that, they've captured Klaar. Can Hans save her, much less himself?

Hans has the truth, and he's taking it to the people. Reviving the legendary Triple X newspaper, Hans, Klaar, and the remaining squatters have printed up the shocking story of Thexoll's plot to create his own twisted utopia. The seed of rebellion spreads quickly, but Hans finds that even the noblest of endeavors has consequences.
"Get Me to the Church on Time." Wally West marries Linda Park in the Park family ancestral home, with family members, friends, and fellow super-heroes in attendance.
name: The Wedding of the Flash

description:
Robin and Aqualad guest-star in a flashback issue written by Joe Casey (Cable, WILD TIMES: GEN13), with art by Duncan Rouleau and Aaron Sowd! After the extra-special issue #150, Waid, Augustyn, Pelletier, and Russell take a one-issue break, so they just provide a framing sequence for this tale from early in Wally West's career, when he and a pal from his neighborhood had to head off an attempted Gorilla City invasion of America!

Fifteen year old Wally West discovers a gorilla lurking inside the Blue Valley, Nebraska, Museum of Humanities after the museum should be closed for the evening. Transforming into Kid Flash, he confronts the gorilla. Kid Flash discovers that Gorilla Montague is not an enemy. Montague is a good guy and not evil, unlike Gorilla Grodd. Montague is attempting to retrieve a simian skull stolen from an ancestral burial ground in the Congo near Gorilla City. Montague warns Kid Flash that he is on a mission to prevent a war between Gorilla City and the United States over the stolen gorilla remains. Respecting gorilla people's indigenous rights, Kid Flash decides to help Montague return the simian remains to Africa. But they must overcome several travel problems, time constraints, and thwart adventurer Buck Wargo who claims to be the rightful owner of the simian skull.

Reprinted in DC Goes Ape #1.
name: Kid Flash in Territorealis

description: Felix Faust (also seen in this month's SILVER AGE) returns, but the Flash isn't going to face him alone...not with the original Captain Marvel on hand! Faust makes his comeback at a broadcasters' convention, where his master plan runs into a trio of detractors: Linda Park, Flash Wally West and some kid named Billy Batson.
name: Magic Words

description: A mysterious villain from Linda's past threatens both her and Wally,  as well as four members of the JLA! Is there any way the Flash can rescue everyone in the space of a single heartbeat?
name: Heartbeat

description:
Part 1 of the 5-part 'Knight Wars': Checkmate launches into action to protect California's water supply...but can they trust the Knights involved? And who is the deadly Bishop who fights against them?

Notes:

  • Wolfgang Schmidt appears as an imagination of Christopher Smith.
  • B.J. is not seen but is on the phone with Harry Stein.
name: One Wet and Wild Knight

description:
Notes:

  • Wolfgang Schmidt appears as an imagination of Christopher Smith.
name: One Wet and Wild Knight, Part 2

description:
Part 3 of the 5-part 'Knight Wars': Who is killing the greatest scientific minds of Europe and America? Only Peacemaker stands a chance of finding out as Checkmate deals with internal problems concerning the freelance assassin known as Bishop.

Notes:

  • Wolfgang Schmidt appears as an imagination of Christopher Smith.
name: Peaceful Knights

description: Part 4 of the 5-part 'Knight Wars': Peacemaker learns the identity of the power behind the deaths of America's and Europe's greatest defense scientists...while Checkmate seeks the identity of the man known as the Bishop.
name: Peaceful Knights: Part Two

description: Part 5 of the 5-part 'Knight Wars': Peacemaker's help is needed as the identity of Bishop is revealed at last...and proves to be a traitor within the ranks of Checkmate.
name: Knight after Knight
